data.title: 22 Best Ways To Earn Lots of Southwest Rapid Rewards Points
data.meta_description: There are so many ways to earn Southwest Rapid Rewards points beyond just flying. Here's what you need to know to earn tons of points.
data.text:
Southwest Airlines is the worldâs largest low-cost carrier, but it does not have any airline partners. This means the points you earn for its Rapid Rewards frequent flyer program are only redeemable on Southwest flights.

So, how fast can you earn tons of Rapid Rewards points? Ultimately, thatâs up to you and the strategies you employ. Luckily, there are lots of easy ways to earn tons of Southwest Rapid Reward points.

Southwest Rapid Rewards Program

To earn points, you need a Rapid Rewards account. Once that is set up, youâll be ready to earn points from credit card sign-up bonuses, everyday spending, shopping portals, and more.

Sign Up for a Rapid Rewards Account

The Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards programÂ is a stand-alone frequent flyer program. Unlike loyalty programs such as American Express Membership Rewards, a Rapid Rewards membership does not require an affiliated credit card to start earning points.

Itâs that simple. While you do not earn any points for registering for an account, youâll need to create an account to start earning points. Southwest will offer bonus points through email promotions, so make sure youâre signed up for Southwest emails, too.

Earn Rapid Rewards Points With Credit Cards

Using credit cards is by far the fastest way to earn Rapid Rewards, and you can earn tons of points with a simple strategy.

1. Chase Ultimate Rewards Credit Cards (Recommended)

The Chase Ultimate Rewards program is the only bank partner of the Southwest Rapid Rewards program. While you might expect a co-branded Southwest credit card to be the best way to earn Rapid Rewards, you would be mistaken!

Chase Ultimate Rewards points are extremely valuable because you can transfer them to many different Chase transfer partners. Chase Ultimate Rewards points transfer 1:1 to Southwest Airlines, so any points you earn on Ultimate Rewards cards can turn into Southwest Rapid Rewards points almost instantly. This is a much better strategy than just collecting Southwest Rapid Rewards points; youâll greatly increase your redemption options but can also redeem for Southwest flights as needed.

Ultimate Rewards-earning credit cards often come with amazing sign-up bonuses that can earn you tons of transferable points that can be used to book travel with Southwest.

And donât forget, Chase Ultimate Rewards points are much easier to earn than Southwest Rapid Rewards points are when using one of Southwestâs credit cards.
